sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

x + y - z = 5
2x - y + 3z = 8
3x + 4y - 2z = 2
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to write the given system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

The given system can be written as:

A = | 1  1 -1 |      x = | x |      b = | 5 |
    | 2 -1  3 |          | y |          | 8 |
    | 3  4 -2 |          | z |          | 2 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A. QR decomposition is a technique to decompose a given matrix A into the product of an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R, i.e., A = QR.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R as follows:

1. Calculate the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = a1 = (1, 2, 3)
e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14)

u2 = a2 - proj(a2, e1) = (1, -1, 4) - ((1, -1, 4) • e1) * e1
u2 = (1, -1, 4) - (11/14) * (1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14)
u2 = (3/14, -17/14, 19/14)
e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (3/√194, -17/√194, 19/√194)

u3 = a3 - proj(a3, e1) - proj(a3, e2) = (-1, 3, -2) - ((-1, 3, -2) • e1) * e1 - ((-1, 3, -2) • e2) * e2
u3 = (-1, 3, -2) - (-1/14) * (1/√14, 2/√14, 3/√14) - (1/194) * (3/√194, -17/√194, 19/√194)
u3 = (-1/2, 1/2, 1/2)
e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (-1/√3, 1/√3, 1/√3)

2. Form the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R:

Q = |  1/√14   3/√194  -1/√3 |
    |  2/√14 -17/√194   1/√3 |
    |  3/√14  19/√194   1/√3 |

R = | ||u1||  a2•e1  a3•e1 | = | √14  11/√14  -1/√14 |
    |   0    ||u2||  a3•e2 |   |  0    √194   1/√194 |
    |   0      0    ||u3|| |   |  0      0     √3   |

3. Solve the system Rx = Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = |  1/√14   2/√14   3/√14 | * | 5 | = | 49/√14 |
          |  3/√194 -17/√194 19/√194 |   | 8 |   |  1/√194 |
          | -1/√3    1/√3    1/√3   |   | 2 |   |  1/√3   |

Now, we have an upper triangular system:

√14 * x1 + 11/√14 * x2 - 1/√14 * x3 = 49/√14
√194 * x2 + 1/√194 * x3 = 1/√194
√3 * x3 = 1/√3

Solving this system, we get:

x3 = 1
x2 = (1/√194 - 1/√194) / √194 = 0
x1 = (49/√14 - 11/√14 * 0 + 1/√14) / √14 = 2

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is x = 2, y = 0, and z = 1.
